title: New Chief of National Intelligence appointed
byline: The Defence Ministry has announced the appointment of Major General (Retired) Ruwan Wanigasooriya as the Chief of National Intelligence, effective from yesterday (January 1).

title: Body found at floating market in Pettah
byline: An unidentified body has been discovered at the Floating Market in Pettah, the police said.

title: Final phase of 2024 third school term begins today
byline: The final phase of the third school term for 2024 in government schools and government-approved private schools commenced today (January 2).

title: More details emerge on ‘Bo Tree’ accident at Matara Prison
byline: One prison inmate has been reported dead, and at least 11 others have been injured and hospitalized following an incident involving a large ‘Bo tree’ branch falling within the Matara Prison premises last night (January 1).

title: Driver in fatal New Orleans truck ramming may not have acted alone, had Islamic State flag
byline: A US Army veteran with an Islamic State flag on his truck swerved around makeshift barriers and ploughed into New Orleans’ crowded French Quarter on New Year’s Day, killing 15 people in an attack officials believe was carried out with the help of others.

title: SLCERT working to restore hacked Sri Lanka Police YouTube channel and Printing Dept’s website
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) has revealed that efforts are currently underway to restore the official website of the Sri Lanka Department of Government Printing and the official YouTube channel of the Sri Lanka Police Department, both of which were subjected to recent cyber-attacks.

title: Inmate dead, 10 injured after tree falls in Matara Prison
byline: One prison inmate is reported dead while at least 10 others have been injured and hospitalized after a large ‘Bo Tree’ had fallen within the Matara Prison premises.

title: Two unidentified bodies found in reservoir in Kilinochchi
byline: The bodies of two unidentified men have been discovered in a reservoir in Puliyampokkanai area along the A35 main road in Kilinochchi, the police reported.

title: Armed man kills 10 including 2 children in shooting rampage in Montenegro
byline: At least 10 people, including two children, were killed and four others were seriously wounded on Wednesday in a shooting rampage that followed a bar brawl in a western Montenegrin city, officials said. The shooter was on the run.

title: Sri Lanka’s first govt pediatric bone marrow transplant unit opens at Apeksha Hospital
byline: The first and only Bone Marrow and Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant (HSCT) Unit in a government hospital for children with cancer in Sri Lanka was inaugurated at the Apeksha Cancer Hospital in Maharagama today (Jan. 02).

title: ‘Education qualifications alone won’t fix governance’ - Dilith calls for fresh perspectives in politics
byline: The ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera underscored the urgency for innovation, creativity, and strategic planning in terms of both governance and economic stability in order to provide pragmatic solutions to the country’s deep-rooted issues.

title: MP Asoka Ranwala highlights importance of proper tax payments by businessmen
byline: Former Speaker and Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala emphasized that the government can only provide proper benefits to the society and beneficiaries if successful businessmen pay taxes properly.

title: 2025’s first Parliament sitting to be held on Jan. 7
byline: The Secretary-General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera stated that Parliament is scheduled to convene from January 7 to January 10, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka to import salt starting tomorrow
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has taken steps to open tenders for the import of 30,000 Metric Tonnes of salt from tomorrow (03).

title: Tesla cybertruck explodes outside Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one
byline: At least one person was killed and seven wounded when a Tesla Cybertruck exploded outside a hotel belonging to US President-elect Donald Trump in Las Vegas, police said Wednesday.

title: Matara Prison inmates transferred to Angunukolapelessa
byline: Steps have been taken to transfer inmates held under Section 54 at the Matara Prison to the Angunukolapelessa Prison following the tragic incident which occurred at the prison premises due to the falling of a large tree branch last night (01).

title: Police enforce law against over 5,400 traffic offenders in 24 hours
byline: Sri Lanka Police have taken legal action against a total of 509 individuals for driving under the influence of alcohol, within the 24-hour period ending at 6 a.m. today (January 2).

title: Former president Ranil meets Nepal’s prime minister
byline: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli and former President of Sri Lanka, Ranil Wickremesinghe, held a meeting today at the Prime Minister’s official residence in Baluwatar, Kathmandu.

title: Labour Ministry introduces WhatsApp number to streamline services
byline: The Ministry of Labor has introduced a new WhatsApp number, 070 7227877, to speed up the responses by the Ministry of Labour and the Labour Department to the issues faced by State and private sector employees.

title: Sri Lanka clears ‘suspicious’ drone found in seas off Trinco, prepares for return
byline: A jet-powered target drone found by local fishermen in the sea area off Trincomalee has been confirmed to pose no threat to the country’s security.

title: ASPI surpasses 16,000 points mark for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a historic milestone today (January 02) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 16,000-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Health sector to get highest-ever fund allocation through 2025 Budget – Minister
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said the highest-ever allocation of funds for the health sector will be made in this year’s budget proposal.

title: Meta wants to flood Instagram and Facebook with AI bots: Report
byline: Artificial Intelligence has been reshaping the way rewrite and search for things on the internet, but it looks like Meta may have another use for the technology.

title: Govt Printing Dept’s website restored after cyber attack
byline: The official website of the Department of Government Printing which was hacked on Tuesday (Dec. 31) has now been restored, according to Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT).
